summary: This bill, the Navajo Nation Rio San José Stream System Water Rights Settlement Act of 2025, aims to settle water rights claims of the Navajo Nation in New Mexico's Rio San José Stream System. It authorizes, ratifies, and confirms an existing agreement between the Navajo Nation, the State of New Mexico, and other parties. The bill defines key terms, establishes a trust fund for settlement implementation, outlines funding mechanisms, and addresses waivers, releases, and jurisdictional issues. It also includes provisions for the expansion of the Navajo-Gallup Water Supply Project and ensures compliance with environmental regulations. The bill aims to provide a fair and equitable solution for the Navajo Nation's water rights while encouraging infrastructure development and economic progress for the communities.
